description: Removal of condition No. 19 (Delivery and Servicing Plan) of planning permission 2020/0962 for 'Construction of a three storey rear extension to accommodate additional dental surgery floorspace and 3 new residential units, with landscaping and associated works' granted on 21/07/2020.
decision_conditions:
<p>The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of the permission issued under 2020/0962 (21/07/2023).</p><p>REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 as amended.<br></p><p>
</p>

<p>Development shall be carried out in accordance with the schedule of materials and samples of such materials and finishes and colours to be used for the external construction of all building(s) submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority as part of application 2020/3232 dated &nbsp;22/12/2020. All materials used shall conform to those approved and thereafter the development shall be constructed with the approved materials.</p><p>Reason: Insufficient information has been supplied with the application to judge the appropriateness of the materials to be used. Submission of samples prior to commencement will ensure that the appearance of the proposed development will harmonise with the character of the surrounding area and comply with policies DM1 and DM2 from the LBH’s ‘Local Plan’ 2015; and policies 7.4 and 7.8 from the ‘London Plan’ 2016 (as amended); and policies 24 and 25 ‘from LBH’s ‘Core Strategy’ 2010.</p>

<p>Development shall be carried out in accordance with the detailed drawings/full particulars showing the matters set out below submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority as part of application&nbsp;2020/3024 dated&nbsp;30/11/2020:</p><p>1:20 elevations and cross sections of each window typology;</p><p>1:5 glazing bar and proposed glazing;</p><p>1:5 section showing the position of the window in relation to the masonry.</p><p>Reason: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory and does not detract from the character and visual amenity of the area.</p>

<p>The works hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details, including plans and cross sections of the existing and proposed ground levels of the development and the boundaries of the site and the height of the ground floor slab and damp proof course in relation thereto submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority as part of 2020/3024 dated&nbsp;30/11/2020.</p><p>Reason: Insufficient information has been supplied with the application to judge the proposed site levels of the proposed development. Submission of a scheme prior to commencement will ensure that the development accords with Section 197 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.</p>

<p>Unless otherwise approved, before development is commenced, a scheme shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority making provision for a Construction Method Statement to control the adverse impact of the development on the amenity of the public and nearby occupiers. The Construction Method statement shall include details of:</p><p>a) parking of vehicles of site personnel and visitors;</p><p>b) storage of plant and materials;</p><p>c) measures for minimising the impact of noise and, if appropriate, vibration arising from construction activities;</p><p>d) predicted noise and, if appropriate, vibration levels for construction using methodologies and at points agreed with the Local Planning Authority;</p><p>e) scheme for monitoring noise and if appropriate, vibration levels using methodologies and at points agreed with the Local Planning Authorities;</p><p>f) siting and design of temporary buildings;</p><p>g) scheme for security fencing/hoardings, depicting a readily visible 24-hour contact number for queries or emergencies;</p><p>h) details of disposal of waste arising from the construction programme, including final disposal points. The burning of waste on the site at any time is specifically precluded. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved scheme and statement.</p><p>Reason: Insufficient information has been supplied with the application in relation to the proposed construction methodology. Submission of details prior to commencement will ensure that the method of construction protects residential amenity. It will also ensure that the development accords with policies DM2(iv, vi) and DM4(a-d) from the LBH’s ‘Local Plan’ 2015; and the Mayor of London’s Supplementary Planning document entitled ‘Sustainable Design and Construction’ 2014.</p>

<p>The proposed blue roof shall be installed as per the detailed specification and layout submitted to and approved by the LPA, in consultation with the SuDS officer, as part of application&nbsp;2021/0201 dated&nbsp;22/03/2021.</p><p>Reason: To ensure that the development is properly drained in accordance with policies 5.3 and 5.13 of the ‘London Plan’ 2017; and policy DM43(a-d) of LBH’s ‘Local Plan’ 2015 and the Mayor of London’s Supplementary Planning document entitled ‘Sustainable Design and Construction’ 2014.</p>

<p>A scheme for the provision and implementation of flood resilient and resistant construction details and measures for the site and in the basement against surface water flood risk shall be implemented as submitted to and agreed, in writing with the LPA in consultation with the LLFA as part of application 2021/0201 dated 22/03/2021. The scheme shall be carried out in its entirety before the basement is occupied and; constructed and completed in accordance with the approved plans in line with BS 8102:2009 code of practice for "protection of below ground structures against water from the ground"; and BS 8582:2013 code of practice for "surface water management for development sites". Mitigation measures may include providing suitable drainage and sump pump where required in the basement.</p><p>Reason: To ensure that the development is properly drained in accordance with policies 5.3 and 5.13 of the ‘London Plan’ 2017 and policy DM43(a-d) of LBH’s ‘Local Plan’ 2015 and the Mayor of London’s Supplementary Planning document entitled ‘Sustainable Design and Construction’ 2014.</p>

<p>Development shall be carried out in accordance with the details of both on-site hard and soft landscape works (in accordance with the illustrative landscape masterplan) submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority as part of application 2020/3232 dated 22/12/2020. These details shall include the following, as relevant:</p><ol><li>existing and proposed finished levels or contours;</li><li>means of enclosure to both the private garden areas and public spaces;</li><li>hard surfacing materials;</li></ol><p>Soft landscape details shall include the following as relevant:</p><ol><li>planting plans;</li><li>written specification (including cultivation and other operations associated with plant and grass establishment;</li><li>schedules of plants, noting species, plant sizes and proposed numbers/densities where appropriate;</li><li>retained areas of grassland, hedgerow and trees;</li><li>implementation programme;</li></ol><p>Reason: To improve the appearance of the site in the interests of visual amenity and to ensure the long term retention of soft landscaping including future protection from those in private gardens and public spaces. In accordance with and policy DM1(v, xi) and DM35 of LBH’s ‘Local Plan’ 2015; and LBH’s SPD on ‘Public Realm Strategy’ 2012 and Mayor of London’s ‘Preparing Borough Trees and Woodlands Strategies’ 2013.</p>

<p>The landscaping approved as part of the development shall be carried out within a period of twelve months from the date on which the development of the site commences or shall be carried out in the first planting (and seeding) season following completion of the development, and shall be maintained to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority for a period of ten years. Such maintenance is to include the replacement of any plants that die, or are severely damaged, seriously diseased, or removed.</p><p>REASON: To accord with the requirements of Section 197(a) of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 and to provide reasonable environmental standards in the interests of the appearance of the site and area.</p>

<p>Space shall be made available for the secure parking of 6 cycles within the site/development/building before the use is first commenced, thereafter those spaces shall remain in perpetuity.</p><p>Reason: To ensure that a reasonable provision is made within the site for the parking of cycles in the interest of relieving congestion in surrounding streets and improving highway conditions in general, in accordance with policy 6.9 of the ‘London Plan’ 2016 (as amended) and policies DM1 and DM47 from the LBH’s ‘Local Plan’ 2015.</p>

<p>The use shall not be commenced unless and until provision for the storage of refuse/recycling bins for both the residential and non-residential uses has been made within the site in accordance with details submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority as part of application 2020/3024 dated 30/11/2020. Thereafter those provisions shall remain in perpetuity.</p><p>Reason: In the interests of amenity of occupiers of the development and also the visual amenity of the development and the locality generally, and in order that the development accords with policies 3.5 and 7.4 of the ‘London Plan’ 2016 (as amended) and policies DM1, DM2 and DM42 of LBH’s ‘Local Plan’ 2015.</p>

<p>Development shall only be carried out in accordance with the details submitted to and approved, in writing, by the Local Planning Authority as part of application 2020/3558 dated 30/12/2020 to demonstrate that the building can achieve ‘Secured by Design’ accreditation.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p>Reason: In the interest of community safety and in accordance with policies 7.3 and 7.4 of the ‘London Plan’ 2016 (as amended) and policies DM1, DM2, DM19 and DM37 of LBH’s ‘Local Plan’ 2015.</p>

<p>All dwellings hereby approved shall comply with Regulation 36 (2)(b) and Part G2 of the Building Regulations - Water Efficiency.</p><p>Reason: In order to comply with Policy 5.15 of the ‘London Plan’ 2016.</p>

<p>All non-CHP space and hot water fossil fuel (or equivalent hydrocarbon based fuel) boilers installed as part of the development must achieve dry NOx emission levels equivalent to or less than 30 mg/kWh.</p><p>Reason: To protect air quality and people’s health by ensuring that the production of air pollutants, such as nitrogen dioxide and particulate matter, are kept to a minimum during the course of building works and during the lifetime of the development. To contribute towards the maintenance or to prevent further exceedances of National Air Quality Objectives.</p>

<p>No soil stacks, soil vent pipes, flues, ductwork or any other pipework shall be fixed to the (street) elevations of the building other than as shown on the drawings approved as part of the original permission&nbsp;2020/0962 dated&nbsp;21/07/2020.</p><p>Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance to the development and a high quality of design, and to safeguard and enhance the character and appearance of the area.</p>

<p>Development shall commence and be carried out in accordance with details and findings of the Preliminary Risk Assessment and Site Investigation document&nbsp;submitted to, and approved by, the Local Planning Authority in writing as part of application 2021/0201 dated 22/03/2021. If any undiscovered contamination is encountered during the next phase of development, works should halt and the local authority should be contacted with further information.</p><p>REASON: In the interests of protecting the natural environment and human health from any harmful contamination-related impacts.<br></p>

<p>Unless otherwise approved, prior to occupation of the development hereby approved, a full air permeability test report confirming the development has achieved an air permeability of 5 m3/h/m2@50pa shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.</p><p>Reason: To protect air quality and people's health by ensuring that the production of air pollutants, such as nitrogen dioxide and particulate matter, are kept to a minimum during the course of building works and during the lifetime of the development. To contribute towards the maintenance or to prevent further exceedances of National Air Quality Objectives.</p>

<p>Unless otherwise approved, prior to the commencement of each phase of development (as defined by the details approved under the scope of condition 1 above), a Demolition and Construction Management and Logistics Plan (DCMLP) shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the Local Planning Authority. The DCMLP(s) shall include, inter alia, the following details:</p><p>(i) Hours of works; and</p><p>(ii) A programme of works; and</p><p>(iii) Routes and measures for traffic management including delivery and collection hours (which should avoid anti-social and peak hours), size and frequency of HGV arrivals and departures, prevention of idling by construction vehicles, construction traffic access and routing arrangements, and any footway or highway closures;</p><p>(iv) Loading and unloading of plant and materials; and</p><p>(v) How materials will be managed efficiently and disposed of legally, and the re-use and recycling of materials maximised; and</p><p>(vi) Storage of plant and materials; and</p><p>(vii) Boundary hoardings behind any visibility zones; and</p><p>(viii) Contact arrangements between residents and contractors.</p><p>All demolition and construction works associated with the development hereby permitted shall thereafter take place in full accordance with the submitted/approved plans/details.</p><p>REASON: In order to ensure that the development does not prejudice the amenity of adjoining occupiers and in the interests of highway safety.</p>
